solution.text:
Given equations are :
_{j}_x + _{i}_y = _{k}_ -------(1)
_{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_ -------(2)
Multiply equation(1) by _{j}_ and equation (2) by _{i}_ to make coefficient of y equal.
Then we get the equations:
_{{j*j}}_x + _{{i*j}}_y = _{{j*k}}_ -------(3)
_{{i*i}}_x - _{{i*j}}_y = _{{i*l}}_ -------(4)
Add both the equations.
So, we get
(_{{i*i}}_+_{{j*j}}_)x + (_{{i*j}}_-_{{i*j}}_)y = _{{k*j}}_+_{{i*l}}_
i.e.,_{{i*i+j*j}}_x = _{{l*i+k*j}}_
i.e.,x = \(_{{i*l+k*j}}_\over _{{i*i+j*j}}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of x in equation 1.
We get
\(_{{l*i+k*j}}_\over _{{i*i+j*j}}_\) + _{i}_y = _{k}_
_{i}_y = _{k}_-\(_{{l*i+k*j}}_\over _{{i*i+j*j}}_\)
_{i}_y = \({_{{k*(i*i+j*j)}}_-_{{l*i+k*j}}_}\over _{{i*i+j*j}}_\)
y = \({_{{k*(i*i+j*j)-(l*i+k*j)}}_}\over _{{i*(i*i+j*j)}}_\)
So, the solution required is:
x = \(_{{l*i+k*j}}_\over _{{i*i+j*j}}_\) and y = \({_{{k*(i*i+j*j)-(l*i+k*j)}}_}\over _{{j*(i*i+j*j)}}_\)

content.text:
Solve the following equation by the elimination method.
_{j}_x + _{i}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - _{j}_y = _{l}_
